titles.title: To eliminate unused sections of the United States Code, and for other purposes.
Clean Up the Code Act of 2018

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security, and Investigations.
Mr. Collins (GA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7093.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 386 - 5 (Roll no. 451).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Government employee pay, benefits, personnel management
Social work, volunteer service, charitable organizations

bill.summary:
Clean Up the Code Act of 2018
This bill repeals specified sections of the federal criminal code, including provisions that prohibit the following:
interstate transport of alligator grass, water chestnut plants, or water hyacinth plants; fraudulent use of the 4-H club emblem (i.e., the green four-leaf clover with stem); unauthorized use of the Smokey Bear character or name; and unauthorized use of the Woodsy Owl character, name, or slogan.
